text: I often see high memory usage in the vscode background julia process and wanted to probe where the memory is used. Is there a way to get interactive access to that process, to run something like `varinfo(LanguageServer, all=true, sortby=:size)` ?

text: I see this too, I occasionally do a `pkill -9 julia` to shut down one or two ghost processes hogging some 2-4Gb even after shutting down vscode
